column2: He already felt drunk enough at the thought of being with Sunny. He glanced at his watch. Eight-twenty-five. He loosened his tie, dark yellow with a muted pattern and unbuttoned the top button of his blue shirt.
column3: It All Began in Monte Carlo

column2: Eight-twenty-five some Acute mentions he used to watch his sister taking her bath; the three guys at the table with him fall over each other to see who gets to write it in the log book. . . .
column3: One Flew Over the Cuckooâ€™s Nest

column2: She sat down in her usual seat and smiled at her husband as he sank into his own chair opposite her. She was saved. It was only five and twenty past eight.
